meanings.sent1: The teacher was tabooing the use of cell phones in class.
meanings.sent2: The government tabooed the sale of certain drugs.
meanings.sent3: The cat was tabooing the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules tabooed any form of cheating in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The parents tabooed their children from watching violent movies.

meanings.definition: To avoid or shun something as socially unacceptable
meanings.sent1: She was tabooing the topic of politics at the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The community tabooed gossiping about others.
meanings.sent3: The dog was tabooing the idea of wearing a silly costume.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure tabooed him from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The group tabooed any form of discrimination in their organization.
